steps.title: Welcome!
steps.content:
Welcome to this Guided Tour. If you are a new user, follow this guided tour to get acquainted to navigating and getting started.

Next: Navigation

steps.title: Navigation
steps.content:
Rundeck navigation is done using the project navigation bar on the left side of the page or from menus under icons in the page header.

Next: Role-Based Access

steps.title: Role based access
steps.content:
Everything you see after logging into Rundeck is based on the access control policy (ACL) defined by the administator. Resources that are governed by ACLs include access to System wide or Project resources.

The Rundeck graphical interface is also driven by the ACL and displays resources and actions that were explicitly granted.

ACL rules apply to your login or group memberships. You can see the groups you belong to by checking the User Profile page.

Manual: Access Control Policy.

Next: User Menu

steps.title: User menu
steps.content:
The User menu lets you logout and view your profile page. Your user profile lists your group memberships and a form to list and generate API tokens.

See User

Next: System Menu

steps.title: System menu
steps.content:
The system menu contains access to: Key Storage, ACLs, System Info, Plugins, and other system controls.

If your login belongs to the â€œadminâ€ group and therefore granted â€œadminâ€ privileges, you can also access, System Configuration, Access Control, System Report, Log Storage, List Plugins, Password Utility and Execution mode.

See Configure

Next: Project Menu

steps.title: Project menu
steps.content:
The left navigation bar lets you choose a project. Once inside a project you can switch to the projectâ€™s Dashboard, Jobs, Nodes, Commands and Activity pages. Project administrators will also be able to access the Project Settings pages.

Next: Projects

steps.title: Projects
steps.content:
A Project organizes and separates the activities you manage with Rundeck. Multiple projects can be maintained on the same Rundeck server and often correspond to a kind of work or group of users.

The End
